algorithm_technique: Identify leaf nodes and roots, then perform BST merges while validating BST properties.
problem_summary_simple: Merge smaller BSTs into a larger one by replacing leaf nodes with other BST roots.
problem_summary_technical: Merge BSTs by replacing leaf nodes with roots of other BSTs, ensuring BST properties are maintained throughout.
time_complexity: O(N) where N is the total number of nodes across all BSTs.
space_complexity: O(N) for storing leaf values and root mappings.
key_insights: The problem requires careful tracking of leaf values and potential root replacements.
BST property validation must occur at each merge step.
A map from value to root is essential for quick lookups.
The process can be viewed as finding a single root that can absorb all others.
